event.title: was occupied by members of the Seneca tribe until 1779

data.event: The area was occupied by members of the Seneca tribe until 1779 when the Sullivan Expedition destroyed their villages, including a Seneca orchard at Lodi Point.

event.title: 1799, in the area of Brokaw Road, a group of New Jersey Dutch farmers settled

data.event: In 1799, in the area of Brokaw Road, a group of New Jersey Dutch farmers settled to form a Dutch Reformed community, eventually having two churches.
Descendents of these original Dutchmen reside in the town today.
